required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: An Open-label, Exploratory Study Assessing the Feasibility of SGM-101, a Fluorochrome-labeled Anti-carcinoembryonic Antigen Monoclonal Antibody for the Intraoperative Detection of Lung Metastasis in Colorectal Cancer

brief_summary.textblock:
Near-infrared fluorescence-guided oncologic surgery (FGOS) with the use of a tumor specific tracer (SGM-101) developed by Surgimab can provide valuable intra-operative information about tumor location and extensiveness. SGM-101 already proven to be safe and valuable in colorectal cancer.
This study aims to prove feasibility for colorectal lung metastases.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Prospective inclusion patients with colorectal lung metastases. Al injected with SGM-101.

primary_outcome.measure: Ability of SGM-101 and a near-infrared camera system to detect colorectal lung metastases.
primary_outcome.description: Intraoperative imaging of colorectal lung metastases based on the tumor-to-background ratio

arm_group.description: Patients included with colorectal lung metastases, SGM-101 7.5-12.5mg, 3-5 days prior to surgery
